location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 9 of 1823 [sic] from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is enclosing the accounts (not present) of the estate of late Mohomed Nebby Khan [Muḥammad Nabī Khān] so that the Governor of Bombay may pass a decision respecting their final settlement; both the executors of the late Mohamed Ali Khan Shushtarce and Sader Azam [Sadr ‘Aẓẓām] claim to be the principal creditors to the estate. It notes that the accounts have been processed by the firm Messrs Arrathoon and Arrakeel Constantine at the request of the Resident.A request is included in the letter from the Resident asking that he be relieved of all responsibility related to the above affair.
